intro: Camellia inusitata, commonly known as the Japanese camellia, is a flowering plant native to Japan and southern Korea. It is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink and white. The plant produces elliptical, glossy leaves that are dark green and arranged alternately along the stems. Camellia inusitata is an evergreen shrub that typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
